title: How to cite multiple authors in a text - Quora

response.answer_text: In accordance with the citation standard you’re using. In most standards I’m aware of, after you hit four authors you use the abbreviation et. al., which means “and others”. So you can cite “Smith”, “Smith and Jones”, “Smith, Jones, and Bloggs” or “Smith et. al.”, where the latter case can simply be Smith, Jones, Bloggs, and Robertson, or Smith with 15 other authors.
